name: MDE Security Center
description: Splunk SOAR connector module for interacting with the Microsoft Defender for Endpoint Security Center API.

max_incidents.description: Max incident to parse from MDE in the ingestion window (default: 250)

mde_ingest_comment.description: Default MDE comment to add on incident ingest

mde_closure_comment.description: Default MDE comment to add on incident closure

filter_list.description: Filter rules custom list (default: 'MDE Security Center Ingest Filter')

field_mapping.description: Field Mapping: A JSON string of {'old_field_name':'new_field_name'} for on-the-fly field renaming

on_poll_behavior.description: Behavior of on poll action for incidents with no filter rule match (default: ignore)

actions.description: Verifies app connection with MDE.
actions.verbose: Validates the asset configuration for connectivity using the supplied configuration and displays summaries of all authentication tokens

force_refresh.description: Remove cached tokens and revalidate credentials.

actions.description: Retrieves a collection of Incidents.
actions.verbose: Microsoft Docs - List incidents API in Microsoft 365 Defender

filter.description: filters to apply: (createdTime ge 2023-08-21T12:00:00Z and status eq 'active')

top.description: limit results to the top x results

actions.description: Retrieves a specific incident by its ID.
actions.verbose: Microsoft Docs - Get incident information API

actions.description: Updates properties of existing incident.
actions.verbose: Microsoft Docs - Update incidents API

status.description: Specifies the current status of the incident

category.description: Classification and determination of the incident
value_list: False positive: Not enough data to validate

comment.description: Comment to be added to the incident

actions.description: Retrieves a collection of Alerts.
actions.verbose: Microsoft Docs - List alerts API

filter.description: filters to apply: (createdTime ge 2023-08-21T12:00:00Z and status eq 'active')

top.description: limit results to the top x results

example_values: Low-reputation arbitrary code executed by signed executable

Binaries signed by Microsoft can be used to run low-reputation arbitrary code. This technique hides the execution of malicious code within a trusted process. As a result, the trusted process might exhibit suspicious behaviors, such as opening a listening port or connecting to a command-and-control (C&C) server.

actions.description: Retrieves specific Alert by its ID.
actions.verbose: Microsoft Docs - Get alert information by ID API

example_values: Low-reputation arbitrary code executed by signed executable

Binaries signed by Microsoft can be used to run low-reputation arbitrary code. This technique hides the execution of malicious code within a trusted process. As a result, the trusted process might exhibit suspicious behaviors, such as opening a listening port or connecting to a command-and-control (C&C) server.

actions.verbose: Microsoft Docs - Update alert

status.description: Specifies the current status of the incident

comment.description: Comment to be added to the incident

example_values: Resolve my alert and assign to secop2
